Hobi Cicip Makanan Viral, Wanita Ini Nyaris Buta Akibat Diabetes
06 Nov 2019, 05:05 by Andi Annisa Dwi Rahmawati - detikFood


Foto: Istimewa

Jakarta - Bagi millennial, mencicip makanan yang sedang viral atau hits jadi kebanggaan tersendiri. Tapi hal ini ternyata bisa berdampak negatif.Tren makanan terus berganti. Selalu ada camilan, minuman, atau bahkan makanan utama yang jadi tren hingga membuat banyak orang ingin mencobanya. Tak jarang, tempat makanan hits itu viral dan jadi perbincangan di media sosial.Para millennial pun kerap penasaran dengan tampilan dan rasa makanan yang tengah tren atau viral. Seperti Sidah, wanita 27 tahun asal Malaysia yang hobi mencicip makanan viral."Saya pikir dulu saya masih muda, jadi saya tidak berpikir kalau akan sakit. Tapi saya alami diabetes dan tekanan darah tinggi di usia 19, yang membuat penglihatan saya memburuk," kata Sidah seperti dikutip dari World of Buzz (6/11).


Bubble tea, salah satu makanan viral yang jadi favorit millennial (Foto: Istimewa)

Baca Juga: Susah Napas Setelah Makan Pedas, Wanita Ini Dilarikan ke Rumah Sakit Ia menyesali kebiasaan buruknya dulu. "Saya menyesal tidak memperhatikan kesehatan ketika masih muda dan hanya mencoba banyak makanan viral. Kebanyakan makanan tersebut tidak benar-benar mengandung nutrisi tapi hanya tinggi gula dan karbohidrat," tuturnya.Sidah baru memulai perawatan lanjutan pada bulan Juli setelah ia alami gangguan penglihatan. Akibatnya, wanita berkerudung ini tidak bisa mengendarai motor untuk bekerja.Sidah lantas melepaskan pekerjaannya sebagai penjahit. Malang, kini ia bergantung hidup pada ibu dan adik laki-lakinya yang bekerja di supermarket.


Sidah alami gangguan penglihatan karena hobi cicip makanan viral (Foto: Istimewa)

Sebelumnya, Sidah juga menjalani perawatan atau pengobatan hanya selama 1 tahun. Ia berhenti minum obat karena terlalu sibuk. Ketika gangguan penglihatannya makin serius, Sidah langsung ke rumah sakit.Pihak dokter menjelaskan gangguan penglihatan Sidah diakibatkan diabetes yang ia derita. Sidah langsung tersadar dan mulai mengubah pola makannya.Ia mulai mengasup makanan sehat dan benar-benar memangkas asupan karbohidrat, lemak, dan gula. Sidah juga menjelaskan kalau ibunya menderita asthma dan serangan jantung juga, jadi dulu ia selalu mengantar sang ibu ke rumah sakit untuk berobat. Tapi kini, Sidah terpaksa meminta bantuan pamannya jika ada kondisi darurat.


Makanan viral atau kekinian kerap tinggi lemak dan gula saja (Foto: Istimewa)

Sementara ayahnya sudah meninggal tahun 2012 karena infeksi. Sejak saat itu, keluarga Sidah hidup dari penghasilan Sidah dan adik laki-lakinya. Tapi kini karena kondisi kesehatan Sidah tidak memungkinkan dirinya untuk bekerja, sumber penghasilan hanya dari adiknya saja.Setiap bulan mereka mendapat santunan RM 200 atau sekitar Rp 676.000 dari departemen kesejahteraan, tetapi masih tidak cukup. "Satu-satunya hal yang saya harapkan sekarang adalah penglihatannya kembali normal. Saya khawatir tentang masa depannya," pungkas ibu Sidah.Baca Juga: Wanita Ini Dilarikan ke RS Setelah Makan Banyak Wasabi yang Dikira Alpukat Simak Video "Food Blogger Tirta Lie Berbagi Cara Temukan Rasa Autentik Bakmi"[Gambas:Video 20detik](adr/odi)

Hobby Tasting Viral Foods, This Woman Almost Blind Due To Diabetes
Nov 6 2019, 05:05 by Andi Annisa Dwi Rahmawati - detikFood


Photo: Special

Jakarta - For millennials, tasting foods that are viral or hits is a matter of pride. But this turned out to have a negative impact. Food trends continue to change. There are always snacks, drinks, or even main foods that are trending to make many people want to try it. Not infrequently, where the food hits it is viral and is a conversation on social media. Millennials are often curious about the look and taste of food that is trending or viral. Like Sidah, a 27-year-old Malaysian woman who likes to taste viral food. "I thought I was young, so I didn't think I would get sick. But I developed diabetes and high blood pressure at the age of 19, which made my eyesight worse," said Sidah as quoted by World of Buzz (6/11).


Bubble tea, one of the millennial favorite viral foods (Photo by courtesy)

"I regret not paying attention to my health when I was young and just trying lots of viral foods. Most of these foods do not really contain nutrients but are only high in sugar and carbohydrates," he said. As a result, this veiled woman could not ride a motorcycle to work. She then gave up her job as a tailor. Malang, now he is dependent on his mother and younger brother to work at the supermarket.


Natural sight impairment due to a hobby of tasting viral food (Photo: Special)

Previously, Sidah also underwent treatment or medication for only 1 year. He stopped taking medicine because he was too busy. When her visual impairment became more serious, Sidah went straight to the hospital. The doctor explained that Sidah's vision loss was caused by the diabetes she was suffering from. Sidah immediately woke up and began to change his diet. He began to consume healthy foods and actually cut intake of carbohydrates, fats, and sugar. Sidah also explained that his mother suffered from asthma and heart attacks too, so first he always took the mother to the hospital for treatment. But now, Sidah is forced to ask his uncle for help if there is an emergency.


Viral or current foods are often high in fat and sugar alone (Photo by courtesy)

While his father died in 2012 due to infection. Since then, Sidah's family has been living on the income of Sidah and her younger brother. But now because Sidah's health condition does not allow her to work, the only source of income is from her younger sibling. Every month they get a compensation of RM 200 or around Rp 676,000 from the welfare department, but it is still not enough. "The only thing I hope for now is that his vision returns to normal. I am worried about his future," concluded Mrs. Sidah. Authentic Noodles "[Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (adr / odi)
